NAEB I1PE NETWORK
November 14, 1952
HEMOj
TO s ALL CHIEF ENGINEERS
FROMj ROBERT JOHNSTON, TAPE NETWORK ENGINEER
RE : ALIGNMENT TAPES.
We have available for immediate use several alignment tapes. These
alignment tapes are made bgr L. S. Toogood in Chicago |M) have recorded
on them a high frequency tone. Much attention was paid in the recording
process to insure that the alignment is perfectly perpendicular to the
travel of the tape. % playing these tapes back on your machines you can
check to see if your alignment is accurate. We urge you to try these
tapes if you have not already done so. We realize that this is not a
cure-all for alignment problems, however, it is one attempt to a solution.
Please fill out the form below and return it to Network Headquarters
and we will mail a copy of alignment tape to you immediately. Wo will
handle this on a first ccme-first serve basis so return your form soon.
IMPORTANT: Do not keep the alignment tape more than one (1) week.
As soon as you have finished using it pleas© return the tape and the reel*
a***#***#*#*****##**#**#****###****###
*• NAEB TAPE NETWORK
RETURN TO NETWORK HDQ. RETURN TO NETWORK HDQ.
STATION WOULD LIKE A COPY OF THE L.S. TOOGOOD ALIGNMENT
WE. WE UNDERSTAND THAT WE ARE NOT TO KEEP THE TAPE FOR MORE THAN ONE
WEEK. AT THE END OF A WEEK, WE WILL RETURN BOTH THE TAPE AND THE REEL
TO NAEB TAPE NETWORK HDQ,
